message: Lion in july, what do you think about?
Hm, not a bad thing at all, autosave improved window handling is a step forward
just speculation, there aren't any serious signs
Is there any hard news I'm missing here? Or is this just speculation?
yeah, just some chat about the osx lion rumor made by some newssites, but any other news are welcome
Another step towards making the Mac just another iOS device I am afraid.
True, until its a totally closed system where apple have to approve all apps etc etc
Just general chat I think.

Would it? I am not sure, besides hardcore video work, if a quad-core laptop is all that handy except for boiling water. I am excited to see where they go with the GPU integration though. Doubt that they will look any different cosmetically.
I wonder what the new MacBook Pros will look like.  A quad core cpu would really be nice.
still waiting for a new ipad, but my not sure if I can hold on much longer
@aseba quite old.
iPad will definitely come in a short period of time. What i'm really sure is that an upgrade on the 13'' macbook pro is coming also. The c2d is getting old...

Also, at the moment there's no difference between the 13'' macbookair and the macbookpro 13'' that would make me choose a pro. 0.4G more of processor is not worth it comparing to nearly half the weight.
What i've read somewhere is that apple will leave macs without superdrive. Which I think is a good idea since I've used only once in my life, just to reinstall osx
I would miss my superdrive, previous laptop didn't have one and just things like watching the occasional DVD became a massive pain.
I'm waiting for the new iPad and iPhone - don't think I can justify a new macbook pro this year :/
@aseba just don't see them giving up on the superdrives just yet. Too many customers would have conniptions, even though there will be an optional 40 dollar usb superdrive.

I feel like it's time to upgrade (typing this on original Black MacBook, not even Core 2). I want a desktop, but have no room for one in my home. And I have an iPad so a MacBook Air doesn't make sense, but I don't really need the power of a Pro..  Aiiii!
I yanked mine in favor of another HD (SSD in main slot) I wonder how many people are running without the superdrive at the moment?
No one mentioned a Blu-Ray drive, I guess I'm the only person who would like to watch one on the go, esp when traveling :)

@bradendouglass I guess for some folks the quad core would be nice.  My macbook pro is my main development and photo editing system.  More cores would be really nice for number crunching when working with scientific data or doing scripted mass image modification.

@seanb I guess I can see the mass image modification and maybe...the scientific data thing. I bet you sap the SATA 2 interface on a traditional hd before you hit the upper limits of the CPU though. Then again, I don't do too much scientific calc so I definitely could be wrong in this case.

what upset me is that the 13" macbook air got a 1440x900 screen and the macbook pro 13" only get a 1280x800. 800 in height is most of the time too small, with those headers on some webpages 2.0 way too big
I was ready to order a MacBook Pro, but with only 1280x800 resolution I won't. I'd always feel like they'll add it any time and then I have the stupid version without it.
